org.tantalum.android

Class AndroidPlatformAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tantalum.android.AndroidPlatformAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlatformAdapter

    public final class AndroidPlatformAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements PlatformAdapter
    Android-specific support routines for Tantalum

      • shutdownComplete

        public void shutdownComplete()
        End the Android Activity class. This will cause the phone to remove the program from the display and free resources. Do not call this automatically. It is called for you when the user navigates to another Activity, or asynchronously after a slight delay when you call Worker.shutdown() to terminate the program.
        Specified by:
        shutdownComplete in interface PlatformAdapter

      • getLog

        public L getLog()
        Description copied from interface: PlatformAdapter
        Get a platform-specific logging class. Add Tantalum logs to the platform's own logs allows you to use filters, redirect from remote device, and any any similar features as for example on Android. On JME we provide USB debugging in a terminal on your PC.
        Specified by:
        getLog in interface PlatformAdapter
        Returns:

      • getFlashCache

        public FlashCache getFlashCache(char priority)
        Description copied from interface: PlatformAdapter
        Get a persistence support class. Each cache is identified by a single character that is both the name of that cache and the priority. These are guaranteed by runtime exceptions at cache creation time to be globally unique within each application.
        Specified by:
        getFlashCache in interface PlatformAdapter
        Returns:

      • getImageTypeHandler

        public ImageTypeHandler getImageTypeHandler()
        Description copied from interface: PlatformAdapter
        Provide a return the converts from common Internet compressed byte[] formats such as PNG and JPG into the platform's native Image object. Note that if you are using a UI framework such as LWUIT that replaces the native image format with it's own wrapper, you should implement that in your app. There is an example of this in the Tantalum LWUIT BBC Reader app.
        Specified by:
        getImageTypeHandler in interface PlatformAdapter
        Returns:

        Return the platform-specific Image type as a resource decompressed from the application JAR
